Reason: The 'dryRun' configuration option in the 'dconverter' software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. When set to true, it may result in additional processing overhead for simulating the conversion process without actually performing it, leading to increased execution time and potentially higher memory consumption. On the other hand, setting it to false would skip this simulation step, resulting in faster execution and lower memory usage. Therefore, the value of 'dryRun' directly affects the overall performance of the system.
